Description: Ostracon (?), section of the upper-body and neck of a red-brown pottery ribbed storage-vessel with one handle surviving, the exterior surface has been worn away in many parts, some areas are covered with a brown slip and remains of one line of red-painted Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394942) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394942)
